description: Also known as the Yellow-collared Lovebird, this species has a striking black 'mask' on its head, a bright yellow collar and breast, and a green body. They also have a white eye-ring.
temperament: Can be a bit shyer and more reserved than other lovebird species, but they are still active, playful, and intelligent birds that can become affectionate with time.
loudness: Loud. Like the Fischer's, they have a high-pitched, shrill call.
vocalization: Not considered talkers. Their communication is through their flock calls and chirps.
dietaryNeeds: A standard lovebird diet of high-quality pellets, supplemented with a variety of fresh vegetables and occasional fruit.
healthPointers: A hardy species with a lifespan of 15-20 years, but like all birds with white eye-rings, they can be prone to eye problems. Ensure a clean cage environment.
housing: Their high-pitched calls can be a problem in apartments. A good-sized cage with plenty of toys is necessary. Minimum 20"W x 20"D x 24"H.
